noun.description: A member of a central Asian people who inhabited the Tarim Basin in the 1st millennium AD.

Either of two extinct languages (Tocharian A and Tocharian B) spoken by the Tocharian people, the most easterly of known ancient Indo-European languages, surviving in a few documents and inscriptions and showing affinities to Celtic and Italic languages.

adjective.description: Relating to the Tocharian or their language.

origin: From French tocharien, via Latin from Greek Tokharoi, the name of a Scythian tribe (almost certainly unrelated to the Tocharians).
